1:
Why are you proud of making trouble, you mighty man?\q The covenant faithfulness of God comes every day.
\q
2:
Your tongue plans destruction\q like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.


\q
3:
You love evil more than good\q and lying rather than speaking righteousness.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
4:
You love all words that devour others,\q you deceitful tongue.
\q
5:
God will likewise destroy you forever;\q he will take you up and pluck you out of your tent
\q and root you out of the land of the living.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
6:
The righteous will also see it and fear;\q they will laugh at him and say,
\q
7:
"See, this is a man who did not make God his refuge,\q but he trusted in the abundance of his wealth,
\q and he was strong when he destroyed others."


\q
8:
But as for me, I am like a green olive tree in God's house;\q I will trust in the covenant faithfulness of God forever and ever.
\q
9:
I will give you thanks forever for what you have done.\q I will wait for your name, because it is good,
\q in the presence of your godly people.
